entry.title: The Control of Asbestos (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Control of Asbestos Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 31) (“the principal Regulations”) which implement as respects Northern Ireland—Council Directive 76/769/EEC (“the Marketing and Use Directive”) (OJ No L 262, 27.9.76, p.201), as amended by Council Directives 83/478/EEC (OJ No L 263, 24.9.83 p.33) and 85/467/EEC (OJ No L 269, 11.10.85 p.56), and Commission Directives 91/659/EEC (OJ No L 363, 31.12.91 p.36) and 1999/43/EC (OJ No L 207, 6.8.99 p.18), on the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations, insofar as it relates to asbestos;Council Directive 83/477/EEC (OJ No L 263, 24.9.83, p.25) as amended by Council Directive 91/382/EEC (OJ No L 206, 29.7.91 p.16) and Directive 2003/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council (OJ No L 97, 15.4.03, p.48) on the protection of workers from the risks related to exposure to asbestos at work;Council Directive 90/394/EEC (OJ No L 196, 26.7.90, p.38) on the protection of workers from the risks related to exposure to carcinogens at work (sixth individual Directive within the meaning of Article 16(1) of Directive 89/391/EEC) insofar as it relates to asbestos; andCouncil Directive 98/24/EC (OJ No L131, 5.5.93, p.11) on the protection of the health and safety of workers from the risks related to exposure to chemical agents at work (fourteenth individual Directive within the meaning of Article 16(1) of Directive 89/391/EEC) insofar as it relates to risks to health from exposure to asbestos.

entry.title: The Newlyn Pier and Harbour Revision (Constitution) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order alters the constitution of the Newlyn Pier and Harbour Commissioners as from 31st May 2010. It provides for the Commissioners to consist of a body of 11 members, with experience in relevant matters. Eight Commissioners will be appointed by the Commissioners and two by the Cornwall Council. They will all have experience in relevant matters. A harbour management representative will hold office as of right. The appointed Commissioners will retire in rotation.

entry.title: The National Health Service (General Dental Services) (Scotland) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for arrangements for the provision of general dental services under the National Health Service in Scotland, and for the preparation and maintenance by each Health Board in Scotland of a dental list.

entry.title: The Home Information Pack (Suspension) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order suspends the operation of all of the duties imposed by sections 155 to 159 of the Housing Act 2004 relating to the content and provision of home information packs.

entry.title: The Employers’ Duties (Registration and Compliance) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision as to the powers which enable the Pensions Regulator (“the Regulator”) to maximise compliance with the duties and safeguards contained in Chapter 1 of Part 1, and sections 50 and 54, of the Pensions (No. 2) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”).

title.div: The Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Commencement No. 3) (Wales) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Deddf Iechyd a Gofal Cymdeithasol 2008 (Cychwyn Rhif 3) (Cymru) 2010

div.p: This Order brings into force on 21 May 2010 provisions of the Health and Social Care Act 2008 (“the Act”) relating to the funding of expenditure on community pharmaceutical services provided as part of the National Health Service in Wales. The principal changes are: firstly, that funding for community pharmaceutical services that previously had been held centrally will become part of the allocations given to Local Health Boards; and secondly, the Welsh Ministers are given powers to designate any element of the remuneration paid by Local Health Boards for community pharmaceutical services which is not referable to the cost of drugs. Designation is a mechanism which allows the Welsh Ministers to control the way the funding of a designated element is apportioned between Local Health Boards.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym ar 21 Mai 2010 ddarpariaethau Deddf Iechyd a Gofal Cymdeithasol 2008 (“y Ddeddf”) sy'n ymwneud â chyllido gwariant ar wasanaethau fferyllol cymunedol a ddarperir fel rhan o'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol yng Nghymru. Dyma'r prif newidiadau: yn gyntaf, y bydd cyllid ar gyfer gwasanaethau fferyllol cymunedol a oedd gynt wedi ei ddal yn ganolog yn dod yn rhan o'r dyraniadau a roddir i Fyrddau Iechyd Lleol; ac yn ail, y rhoddir pwerau i Weinidogion Cymru i ddynodi unrhyw elfen o'r gydnabyddiaeth a delir gan Fyrddau Iechyd Lleol ar gyfer gwasanaethau fferyllol cymunedol ac nad yw'n elfen sydd i'w phriodoli i gost cyffuriau. Mecanwaith yw dynodiad sy'n caniatáu i Weinidogion Cymru reoli'r ffordd y dyrennir cyllido elfen ddynodedig rhwng Byrddau Iechyd Lleol.

title.div: The Civil Enforcement of Parking Contraventions (City and County of Cardiff) Designation Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Dynodi Gorfodi Sifil ar Dramgwyddau Parcio (Dinas a Sir Caerdydd) 2010

div.p: This Order designates the area described in the Schedule as a civil enforcement area and a special enforcement area for the purposes of Part 6 of the Traffic Management Act 2004. The practical effect of the Order is to enable the County Council of the City and County of Cardiff to enforce parking contraventions within the area described in the Schedule to the Order through a civil law regime, as opposed to enforcement by police or traffic wardens in a criminal law context.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dynodi'r ardal a ddisgrifir yn yr Atodlen yn ardal gorfodi sifil ac yn ardal gorfodi arbennig at ddibenion Rhan 6 o Ddeddf Rheoli Traffig 2004. Effaith ymarferol y Gorchymyn yw galluogi Cyngor Sir Dinas a Sir Caerdydd i orfodi'r gyfraith ar dramgwyddau parcio o fewn yr ardal a ddisgrifir yn yr Atodlen i'r Gorchymyn hwn. Yn hytrach na thrwy'r heddlu neu wardeiniaid traffig mewn cyd-destun cyfraith trosedd, caiff y gyfraith hon ei gorfodi drwy gyfundrefn cyfraith sifil.

entry.title: The Energy Performance of Buildings (Certificates and Inspections) (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations ensure the continued implementation in England and Wales of article 7 of Directive 2002/91/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2002 on the energy performance of buildings (OJ No L 1, 4.1.2003, p. 65) (“the Directive”). The Directive lays down the requirements for the production of energy performance certificates when buildings are constructed, sold or rented out, display of certificates in large public buildings and regular inspections of air-conditioning systems.

entry.title: The Social Fund Winter Fuel Payment (Temporary Increase) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations modify the Social Fund Winter Fuel Payment Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 to provide for an increase in winter fuel payments for winter 2010/2011.

entry.title: The Plant Health Fees (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Plant Health Fees (Scotland) Regulations2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”). The 2008 Regulations set out fees for inspections for plant passporting purposes, licensing services and potato quarantine testing.

entry.title: The Plant Health (Scotland) Amendment Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health (Scotland) Order 2005 (“the principal Order”) so as to implement Council Directive 2007/33/EC of 11th June 2007 on the control of potato cyst nematodes and repealing Directive 69/465/EEC (O.J. L156, 16.6.2007, p.12).

entry.title: The Air Quality Standards (Scotland) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, implement the following Directives:—

title.div: The Vale of Glamorgan (Communities) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Bro Morgannwg (Cymunedau) 2010

div.p: This Order, made in accordance with section 58(2) of the Local Government Act 1972, gives effect to proposals by the Local Government Boundary Commission for Wales (“the Commission”) which reported in September 2009 on its review of the community boundaries in the County Borough of the Vale of Glamorgan. The Commission’s report recommended a change to the boundaries between the communities of Llandough and Michaelston, Llanmaes and Llantwit Major, Penarth and Sully and Pendoylan and Welsh St.Donats and to the number of community councillors returned for wards in the community of Llantwit Major. This Order gives effect to the Commission’s recommendations without modification.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn, a wneir yn unol ag adran 58(2) o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 1972, yn rhoi eu heffaith i gynigion gan y Comisiwn Ffiniau Llywodraeth Leol i Gymru (“y Comisiwn”) a adroddodd ym mis Medi 2009 ar ei adolygiad o'r ffiniau sirol ym Mwrdeistref Sirol Bro Morgannwg. Argymhellodd adroddiad y Comisiwn newid i'r ffiniau rhwng cymunedau Llandochau a Llanfihangel-y-pwll, Llan-maes a Llanilltud Fawr, Penarth a Sili a Phendeulwyn a Llanddunwyd ac i nifer y cynghorwyr cymuned a etholir ar gyfer wardiau yng nghymuned Llanilltud Fawr. Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhoi eu heffaith i argymhellion y Comisiwn heb eu haddasu.

entry.title: The Sports Grounds and Sporting Events (Designation) (Scotland) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order consolidates, with amendments, the previous Sports Grounds and Sporting Events (Designation) (Scotland) Orders.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Rules of the Court of Session Amendment No. 4) (Miscellaneous) 2010
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt makes amendments to the Rules of the Court of Session 1994.

entry.title: The Vacancies in Suffragan Sees and Other Ecclesiastical Office Measure 2010 (Appointed Day No. 1) Instrument 2010
The Penalty Charges (Exemption from Criminal Proceedings) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Penalty Charges (Exemption from Criminal Proceedings) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 by substituting a new offence provision relating to taxi stands. The new provision is an offence under Article 27A(2) of the Road Traffic Regulation (Northern Ireland) Order 1997.

title.div: The Education (Amendments Relating to the Intervals for the Inspection of Education and Training) (Wales) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Diwygiadau ynglŷn â'r Ysbeidiau rhwng Arolygiadau Addysg a Hyfforddiant) (Cymru) 2010

div.p: Cyhoeddir y fersiwn hon o Rheoliadau Addysg (Diwygiadau ynglŷn â'r Ysbeidiau rhwng Arolygiadau Addysg a Hyfforddiant) (Cymru) 2010 o dan awdurdod a goruchwyliaeth Argraffydd Deddfau Seneddol y Frenhines a Rheolwr Gwasg Ei Mawrhydi. Fe'i paratowyd i adlewyrchu'r testun fel y'i gwnaed.

entry.title: The Companies (Disqualification Orders) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Companies (Disqualification Orders) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (S.R. 2003 No. 347) (“the 2003 Regulations”). They come into operation on 18th June 2010, and apply to any disqualification order made after that date, and to any grant of leave or action taken by a court after that date in consequence of which a disqualification order or undertaking (whenever made or accepted) is varied or ceases to have effect.

title.div: The Air Quality Standards (Wales) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Safonau Ansawdd Aer (Cymru) 2010

div.p: These Regulations implement the following Directives—
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn rhoi ar waith y Cyfarwyddebau canlynol—
